channel.title: Can someone help me write a login code?

item.title: Can someone help me write a login code?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:6, topic:340888”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=437283.msg3213325#msg3213325 date=1274479008]

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Tyler") && connectedFrom.equals(127.0.0.1)) { yell("Owner Tyler has logged in!"); }
[/quote]

public void yell(String s) { for(Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { client everyone = (client) p; everyone.sendMessage(s); } }[/quote]
Thanksss. I assumed it was declared already.

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone help me write a login code?

item.title: Can someone help me write a login code?
item.dc:creator: @alpha_0nx alpha 0nx
item.description:
@alpha_0nx wrote:

so what I am getting out of this is that ou want to make personalized login messages?? if this is the case, Here is the code on how to do this (deob 317)

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("YOUR NAME HERE")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "INSERT YOUR LOGIN MESSAGE HERE"; }

It is a very simple code but it works. You do not need the whole ip address and “online=true” thing. Please tell me if this doesnt work.

frostscapeserver:

sM only sends a message to you, not the server, but thanks. I’ll try the other one now.

sM needs to be replaced with PlayerHandler.messageToAll

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone help me write a login code?

item.title: Can someone help me write a login code?
item.dc:creator: @iamapker iamapker
item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

ok bro let me help you out with the log in part cuz i did it on mine. find your welcome message like when you log in it says “welcome to blah blah blah” right? or whatever the message is in the chatbox when you log in now under that added this

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("your name")) { yell("Owner of server, your name Has Logged In!"); } if (playerRights == 0) { yell(""+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); } if (playerRights == 1) { yell("Mod-"+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); } if (playerRights == 2) { yell("Admin-"+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); }

just add this under your welcome message

Read full topic

item.title: Can someone help me write a login code?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“frostscapeserver, post:9, topic:340888”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=437283.msg3213334#msg3213334 date=1274479664]

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Tyler") && connectedFrom.equals(127.0.0.1)) { yell("Owner Tyler has logged in!"); }

public void yell(String s) { for(Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { client everyone = (client) p; everyone.sendMessage(s); } }

Where do I have to write the second code? o.O
[/quote][/quote]

Anywhere under the class declaration, just make sure you aren’t placing it within any other methods.

item.title: Can someone help me write a login code?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("playerName") {
yell(""+playerName+" has logged in!");
}

Just a note that some variables might be wrong, i.e. the ‘yell’ might be different etc…

item.title: Can someone help me write a login code?
item.dc:creator: @frostscapeserver frostscapeserver
item.description:
@frostscapeserver wrote:

I’ve asked this before and had little success with answers. I’m trying to write a code that sends a message out to the server saying they’'ve logged in/ out.
But I want to make it custom. Ex.
I tried playing around with it and I came up with this (even though it doesn’t work)

if(player.EqualsIgnoreCase(“Tyler”) &&(connection= 192.168.1.1)
online=true
modyell(“Owner Tyler has logged in!”)

Anyone know how to tweak it? :0

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone help me write a login code?
